thread.title: Thai PTT signs deal with Malaysia's Petronas for LNG import
thread.title_full: Thai PTT signs deal with Malaysia's Petronas for LNG import

title: Thai PTT signs deal with Malaysia's Petronas for LNG import
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Oct 20, 2015, 07:17 BST - UK Markets open in 43 mins. Thai PTT signs deal with Malaysia's Petronas for LNG import Reuters – 12 minutes ago 269.00 +2.00 
BANGKOK, Oct 20 (Reuters) - PTT Pcl, Thailand's top energy firm, said it has signed a long-term contract with Malaysia's Petronas to import 1 million tonnes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) a year to secure the country's gas supply. 
State-controlled PTT plans to secure 70 percent of its LNG need through the long-term contract, with the remaining 30 percent from spot markets, Chairman Piyasvasti Amranand told reporters. 
The country's energy policy makers have approved plans for PTT to import LNG in long-term contracts from three suppliers - Qatar Liquefied Gas Co Ltd, Shell Eastern Trading and BP Singapore PTE Ltd. 
(Reporting by Khettiya Jittapong; Editing by Subhranshu Sahu) Tax cuts, pensions, childcare, online accounts and beer duty, here's … Related Stock Articles Follow the quotes you care about most.
